title: How to find a song through the music video description - Quora

response.answer_text: There’s this song that I have been trying to find forever… I only remember the music video though. It starts off with what I presume as a memory of a boy when he was younger playing with bubbles with his mom. Then it goes to him as an adult sitting in his car staring at a graveyard. There’s another scene where it’s another memory of him as a kid and he comes home and finds his dad or grandpa on the couch with a beer in his hand sleeping, so he tries to take it but the grandpa gets up and starts yelling at him so the boy runs out of the house and walks down the sidewalk. Then there’s another scene where a chef gets yelled at by a top chef and gets fired and walks outside and hits the side of his car. I believe the song is by a white rapper or singer cause I remember him in one of the scenes. Last scene I remember is back at the man staring at the graveyard until he decides to go to a liquor store to buy some sort of alcohol to bring to some grave. Then it shows him placing the alcohol on his (maybe grandpa/dad?)’s gravestone, then his wife shows up beside him. If anyone knows this pleaaaase let me know!!

I've been trying to find a song but I only remember a couple parts of the music video Dont remember anything about the lyrics or rhythm In the music video there's a security camera recording the inside of the house. There was 3 guys in the vid Guy 1 Guy 2 And guy 3 is what I'll call em From what I remember in the video the ppl in the vid would freeze but the lyrics and it'd zoom into lyrics of the song then everything would unfreeze in the music vid I remember one part where there was a 2 bed side to side with a small drawer on the side with a lamp,wallet and a gun in front of the bed was guy 3 sitting on a chair tied up and in the video there were another 2 guys in the room drinking alchohol,then one of them becomes angry and punched guy 3 who is tied up.Guy 2 pulls him away and they start arguing,guy 1 gets mad and grabs the gun and points it at guy 2 and starts yelling at him or something.Eventually guy 1 shoots guy 2 and searches him for money then leaves the room.Then at the end of the video It shows outside 2 guys or 1 guy and 2 girls walking into the home. If you know the song that'll be great cause I've been looking for it for literally a year. Please help me find the song

There’s this one music video I’ve seen when I was younger that Ive been trying hard to find since but had no luck so far. The music video is shot in a big white empty room in daylight (you can tell because there are windows each on two sides of the room parallel to each other with white light shining through.) In the video, the lead singer is hovering in the middle of the room while the camera rotates anti-clockwise around the room rather fast while focusing on the lead singer in stop-motion style. At one point, there’s a close up of the lead singer singing, ‘yeah’ as part of the song’s lyrics, then there’s a close up of his feet hovering off the floor. Thoroughout the video, several objects appear and disappear (mannequins and speakers, I think). Near the end of the music video, the whole scene changes to nighttime. Song had bit of a Presets-like sound to it, but with a more gloomy, mysterious tone to it. Also, the song tempo was around 120pm approximately. If anyone can figure out the name of the music video/song with these details, let me know in the comments below. Cheers.

I also need help finding this song. I used to wake up on a regular to watch vh1 jump start and some of the songs they played were either fresh out and didnt get attention or popular present and new songs. It was between 2011–2012 and it came out around the same time never again by grace potter and the nocturnals. It also gave off that same vibe. I can't remember the tune but it's in black and white, a guy is singing, it's kind of upbeat but chill, and in the video it looks like a woman is running from someone and every time she does something 2-3 other women do it as well like an echo. Things in the video happen by 3s, theres a triangle involved. Someone please help cuz at this point it feels like a fever dream that I know is real

I need help too. There is this duo of brother and sister, sister has a really great voice, they sing kind of funky/dicso energetic style. They are called something like LAUREN or LAURA (i cant find them with that name). There are 2 videos that I remember. One is simple, everything is filmed in studio, white (maybe light blue) room, there is a bench, the girl is sitting down next to some guy, and she is feeling nervous and shy, so lighting is dark, but when she sings about how she feels, as if no one is watching, it becomes more colourful and she is dancing. another video is in a retro pizzeria or something like that. The girl is on a date with a guy who wont talk stop talking about himself. so she starts singing how she is bored of litening to him while he talks the whole video. at some point she gets under the table to get to the other side. at the table next to them the band is sitting. its super fun and energetic song. please help

I also have an early 2000s song I've been looking for and haven't been able to find for several years!! I remember it was almost pop punky, maybe a “finding yourself" or “overcoming hardships" kind of vibe but there was a shaggy blonde guy in the music video in black(?) clothes running around in an abandoned town I think (maybe somewhere in the desert or maybe it was just dusty, idk) and eventually at the end of the video he sees a shadowy figure that I think he was running from and accepts it possibly and stops running as the figure disappears. I dont remember the song being super popular or anything and the first time I heard it was because it was one of those predownloaded songs on my old tiny at&t phone but I haven't been able to find it since.

Any help identifying this song would be helpful! I recall watching it on YouTube in the mid to late 2000s at some point. Video starts with a girl with short brown hair in a cubicle. She is wearing a white shirt and a short "school girl" plaid pleated skirt. She is getting hit on by a guy and she gets upset and leaves. As she is walking away the lights in the office dim and the overhead florescent lights flash directionally to a room where a band plays. She floats to this room and dances there. During the main part of the song the band randomly flashed on screen in different colors as she dances. The music video ends with the lights to the room, which is a public bathroom, being turned on by an old lady. The girl immediately stops dancing and leaves the room. The lyrics may say something about dancing, but I cannot recall. The band was all Male and the lead singer had dark brown shaggy hair. Any help would be appreciated!

I'm looking for a music video but i only remember parts of it scenes, none of lyrics or artists. That scene was shot on one of NY freeways, at night. The main actor/singer was sitting in the middle of dat freeway, playing piano. It was a beautiful scene tho. Even though i cant remember any of the song's lyrics but i can say i knows its type of melody, kind of “Fun.” style —An American pop rock band, specifically like “We Are Young” or “Some Nights”. I have the feeling that that main actor/singer was Nate Ruess -one of Fun. members. OH SHIT!! Right when i’m writing this i was looking for his name on YT, it's “Nothing Without Love” by Nate Ruess. And if you haven't, I think you should give it a try, this song IMPRESSED me.

Hi! I also have this song stuck in my head, and all I can remember was the melody of its chorus, and the scenes in the music video. It was about 3 AM in my hotel room when I opened my tv that brought me to this music video, which looked like it played a good 1 and a half minute already. The female artist looked a bit like marilyn manson, had quite bigger teeth, and the music video was creepy, but very hooking. There were only 2 alternating scenes in the mv: one where the artist was in a farm with two other creepy creatures: she was wearing a white clown costume, had bright red lipstick and orange brown hair. A long, inanimate, black furry figure and another indistinguishable creature accompanied her. The other scene was a close up of her in pale white skin, with black paint on some parts of her face, with black lipstick and thick black eyeliner, and a hood. The song was very calm, and the melody of the chorus was repetitive, more especially at the end. If someone knows or has encountered the mv please tell me :<<< thanks

I am also trying to figure out the name of a song. i only remember the music video. It is a pop techno type of song that mustve been released around 2016 or 2017. Ok, so in the music video if I'm not mistaken it is sung by a female artist and the music video is literally a house or rooms that are split in half by Pink paint and light blue paint. The people in the music video sit at a dinner table and they also are split in half by wearing pink and the other half wearing light blue. Does anyone know the name of this song. Its kind of like a party song.

I'm trying to find a song,it starts out as a sign on a side of a building for auditions for there music video.Then there's a bunch of different people trying out and they didn't know that They were being recorded so theyre all on the music video,and there's like 2–3 judges there.Then as it gets to the end a bunch of dancers come out with like ribbons and confetti and the people who tried out started dancing with them

Hello, I’m looking for a music video that is just too hard to find. All I can remember is that the singer is African american, during the song he wears a big jacket, it may have been fury, like an extravagant jacket. He has no shirt on. He is like at a party on a small stage. The music is like dark indie, and i believe he raps during the song. It came out around 2014, the guy has wings on his shoes or jacket can't remember. I seem to imagine the jacket yellow, I don’t know if that is enough info to identify it. The band isn’t famous, that one music video was for their only somewhat famous song. thank you.

Hi Brandon, I hope this is what you want. I may not be answering your question as you hope. if I may give an example. i had a few lines in my head of a song we sang in primary school. …’roll roll roll on your way, Snowy River roll on your way’ and I forgot the rest of the lyrics: and of course I could hum the tune, but I wanted tune and words, I put those few words into Google and up came the the complete lyrics to the song, and the song title. Then put song title into YouTube and up came the whole shebang!

I am looking for a song…The only audio part I remember is a chorus with a “na na na” and I also remember it had auto tune...and the music video was “filmed” through a sniper camera that was fallowing a guy (like he was preparing to shot him) the scene was begging with a guy upstairs in an apartment dressing up and then the sniper camera was waiting for the the guy to come downstairs, at the building entrance and following him on the street. Can any one help me please?

After years of trying to find a specific song/music video, it finally came down to this question in hopes of receiving some sort of answer. I listened to a rap song four years ago that had two male vocalists who were in the middle of a blizzard. I believe both or one had a face mask that went about half-way up the face, along with wearing a puffy, orange winter coat as well. Also, the face mask itself had a skull. It may not be enough description but that is all I have at the moment. Any help would be appreciated.

Hello, can anyone help me find name of the song by video description?Song is about asian girl on airport, she look like a model and she is carrying briefcase with clothes while she wait for her plain to called-out she fall a sleep. Then some business man come to her and cover her with a coat. Song is in James Morrisons style as i can remember. Video have blueish tone kinda melancholic. Any suggestion would be helpful. Thanks in advance!

I’ve been driving myself crazy for the past week trying to think about this one song. I don't remember the tune or the artist I just remember little parts of the music video. Part of it is the artist (white male) singing, and then there is an underwater shot so the voice is autotuned while the shot is underwater. Underwater you see a woman in a white dress sinking, looking up. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

I know what you mean. But I don't think that can work as people generally don't describe music videos by keywords. One thing that I do is I just try to remember one line of the song or the artist name and google it . You will get some song names with respect to that one line. Then YouTube the song.

I am looking for a song, a music video where a guy at first follows a girl then kidnaps her then does the same with a man and then ties both of them with ropes and then does human puppetry with their tied bodies in an empty theatre in front of a few audience where infact the audiences have been tied up and are forced to watch the puppetry. With the help of the ropes he moves the tied bodyies of the two kidnapped persons and makes them kiss each other. I don't remember the name of the song. I remember seeing the video for the first time in Nat Geo Music, a channel which apparently isn't aired now. Please help me if you know the song. Thanks.

I cant remember the lyrics of this song but a little bit of the video. It starts with a man and a woman on a Four wheel drive, drives in a jungle. In the start you just hear the Sound of the motor, and Then the music starts. I thought it was flo rider who made it, cus i remember it was a Black man singing. They are having a party in this kinda jungle and just dancing and stuff. Its a song from 2000–2015 i Think. A summer song and Everyone should know it. Please help a sister out here!

You can't unless you know at least some of the words they sing in the song. Say them into Google's microphone and the song title will pop up and it will also list the artist. Otherwise you will have to describe the video to someone who watches music videos and see if they know the title and can name it.Could take a long time to find the right person who can name the title. Frustrating, I know.
